label: Algorithmic Complexity
mathematical_goal: Demonstrate that the G2 manifold has minimal algorithmic complexity for its explanatory power
theoretical_significance: Algorithmic complexity K(x) measures the shortest program that produces x. The G2 manifold specification requires only ~20 bits (dimension, holonomy type, b3, chi_eff) yet derives 125 physical parameters (8000 bits at 64-bit precision). The compression ratio of ~400:1 suggests the G2 manifold is an optimal 'compression' of physical law. This is related to the unreasonable effectiveness of mathematics in physics.
